Exaggerate: The claim that the United States has "the highest corporate tax rate in the free world" may be considered an exaggeration. While the United States does have a high statutory tax rate compared to other OECD countries, there are non-OECD countries with higher rates that were not included in the comparison.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide a comprehensive comparison of corporate tax rates across all countries in the free world.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the United States' corporate tax rate is the highest in the free world without considering all relevant factors and countries.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of an alternative explanation in the provided claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are non-OECD countries with higher corporate tax rates than the United States.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
